comment.text:
In mate-desktop the seamonkey svg icon is not displayed correctly.
If I change font size from 12 to 15 the icon appears in the panel, but not in the menu.
But if I delete comments from seamonkey.svg, the icon displays correctly in the panel and menu.
It's strange and I don't know why this is happening.
You can see what it looks like in the video https://youtu.be/2YCp96p0utc

Well, capable to reproduce it.

Seems MATE allows only one one-line comment before <svg>...</svg> block.

Fortunately it allows several comments, and even a multiline comment just after the initial <svg ...... >

I'll try to fix it properly in the nearest time.

sunwire,

Could you please test a new variant of the svg icon: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/attachment.cgi?id=9187809 ? Ie. place it as /usr/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/apps/seamonkey.svg

KDE4 seems unaffected (under CentOS-7).

Probably some gtk2/gtk3 issue.

A similar seamonkey-mail.svg seems OK.
The difference is that seamonkey.svg has several comments, and some of the comments are multiline.

Could you please test with various comments variants? Ie. unite all into one big comment, try to leave only one line (as in seamonkey-mail.svg) etc.etc.etc.

I've also tested that el7's Mate affected, and even el6-'s Gnome2 affected too (besides F33).

Could you check KDE and/or Gnome3?

I don't have KDE.
In Gnome3 the icon show in "favorites"  but doesn't show in "show applications" so Gnome3 is also affected.
Replacing the icon also resolves the problem.

@sunwire

Gtk-based menu loads icons using gdk-pixbuf2 (which uses a specific handler for each image type).
To understand what format the image is, a small amount of bytes at the head of the file is read (similar to file(1) command).

Certainly if the key fragment "<svg" are present at offset more than 256 bytes (200 + the first <?xml...> string), it is unlikely that anybody will read the whole file then just to understand its format. 

BTW, if we put "<svg>" inside the comment (but somewhere in  [0, 256]), it fixes the issue too... :)

Thanks for report and help!
Will there be an update for 2.53.5.1?
The needed patches from upstream 2.53.5.1 are already backported in 2.53.5-2

bugs.title: SeaMonkey Web Browser icon on LXQt Quick Launch bar is smaller than the rest of the icons

bugzilla.short_desc: SeaMonkey Web Browser icon on LXQt Quick Launch bar is smaller than the rest of the icons

long_desc.thetext:
Created attachment 1711359
Screenshot of the LXQt Quick Launch bar showing the different icon size for SeaMonkey Web Browser.

Description of problem:

Added SeaMonkey Web Browser and SeaMonkey Mail launchers to the LXQt Quick Launch bar and the icon for SeaMonkey Web Browser is smaller than the rest of the icons. 

The SeaMonkey Mail icon, as well as the others displayed in the attached screenshot, are of the correct size. 

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):

2.53.3


Additional info:

Please see attached screenshot. The two SeaMonkey icons are at the far right.

Do not know if this is a SeaMonkey or LXQt issue, but noticed the same with previous SeaMonkey versions.

The whole list of SeaMonkey icons is:

/usr/share/icons/hicolor/16x16/apps/seamonkey-mail.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/16x16/apps/seamonkey.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/32x32/apps/seamonkey-mail.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/32x32/apps/seamonkey.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/48x48/apps/seamonkey-mail.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/48x48/apps/seamonkey.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/64x64/apps/seamonkey.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/128x128/apps/seamonkey.png
/usr/share/icons/hicolor/scalable/apps/seamonkey-mail.svg

Probably the case you described might be related seamonkey-mail has an svg icon. In some combination of dpi and height of the bar, it might be possible that the svg icon is chosen (and provides the right size), but for browser there are "fixed size" png icons only.

Could you try to change the height of the bar (if it is possible) just to see what happens then?

Created attachment 1711385
Screenshot showing LXQt Quick Launch bar with Icon Size set to 24 px.

Thank you for the reply. 

Changing the Size (height) of the bar (default: 32 px) had no effect. The Icon Size default was 22 px. Changing this to 23 also had no effect, but when changed to 24 (in the new screenshot attached), the icon then enlarged to match the size of the others.

Well, since there is no 22 px icon, it seems that 16 px was chosen.
For 24 px (no such icon as well) probably something can be scaled (from 48 px).

For seamonkey-mail there is scalable svg icon, suitable for all the sizes.

Unfortunately, an icon for the browser in svg format is not provided :( .

After a long "archaeological" search on the other side of the planet, a lost icon source in svg format was found in some backups, and through "pigeon mail" it eventually got to the developers. :)

Should be present in upcoming 2.53.5 .
